name: Dickenson Canyon
description:
Introduction

A rugged Mogollon Rim canyon. Drops fast with scenic boulder hopping through rarely visited area.

Approach

Hike down obvious drainage.

Descent

R1: 30' optional or downclimb RDC.

R2: 125' off of tree RDC. Very scenic rappel through mossy layers. Free hanging for about 100ft. Continue down after first ledge.

R3: 35' off of large log or downclimb LDC down steep ledges.

A few large boulder downclimbs until canyon opens up.

Exit

Continue down in drainage over boulders to confluence with Pine Creek. Continue down to Pine Creek trail. Follow Pine Creek switchback trail up to exit vehicle.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background

First known descent by Melissa Gibbons, Jacob Cowan, and Erek Burek on Oct 2, 2022.
